p: Parietaria judaica L. (PJ) is commonly known as pellitory which belongs to the Urticaceae family and wildly growing in the northern countries of Africa, western regions of Asia, and the southern parts of Europe [ 6]. It is a perennial upright or spreading herbaceous plant reaching 1â€‰m in height. The stems are greenish-brown or reddish-brown, are often much-branched, and are covered in irregularly curled hairs. The leaves have an oval shape, which is covered in irregular hairs, and they also have glossy upper surfaces. The flowers are borne in small, dense clusters in the leaf forks. They are initially greenish, but often turn reddish or reddish-brown as they mature [ 7].
